org.jetel.component

Class DataRecordTransform

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jetel.component.AbstractDataTransform
      • org.jetel.component.DataRecordTransform
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RecordTransform, Transform

    public abstract class DataRecordTransform
extends AbstractDataTransform
implements RecordTransform
    Base class used for generating any kind of data transformation. Subclass this one to create your own transformations. It implements basic stubs for all of the RecordTransform interface methods.

    Order of execution/methods call

    1. setGraph()
    2. init()
    3. transform() for each input&output records pair
    4. optionally getMessage() or signal() or getSemiResult()
    5. finished()
    Since:
    November 1, 2003
    See Also:
    RecordTransform

      • init

        public boolean init()
             throws ComponentNotReadyException
        Method to be overriden by user. It is called by init(Properties,DataRecordMetadata[],DataRecordMetadata[]) method when all standard initialization is performed.
        This implementation is just skeleton. User should provide its own.
        Returns:
        true if user's initialization was performed successfully
        Throws:
        ComponentNotReadyException

      • transform

        public abstract int transform(DataRecord[] inputRecords,
            DataRecord[] outputRecords)
                       throws TransformException
        Transforms source data records into target data records. Derived class should perform this functionality.
        This basic version only copies content of inputRecord into outputRecord field by field. See DataRecord.copyFieldsByPosition() method.
        Specified by:
        transform in interface RecordTransform
        Parameters:
        sourceRecords - input data records (an array)
        targetRecords - output data records (an array)
        Returns:
        RecordTransform.ALL -- send the data record(s) to all the output ports
        RecordTransform.SKIP -- skip the data record(s)
        >= 0 -- send the data record(s) to a specified output port
        < -1 -- fatal error / user defined
        Throws:
        TransformException
        See Also:
        org.jetel.data.DataRecord#copyFieldsByPosition()

      • transformOnError

        public int transformOnError(java.lang.Exception exception,
                   DataRecord[] sources,
                   DataRecord[] target)
                     throws TransformException
        Description copied from interface: RecordTransform
        Performs reformat of source records to target records. This method is called as one step in transforming flow of records.
        For example in simple reformat situation, for one input record, one output record has to be generated. Thus for each incoming record, this method is called by Reformat component.
        The number of source records (sources[]) and target records (target[]) depends on particular component configuration. Can be 1:1 , N:1 or N:M.
        Called only if RecordTransform.transform(DataRecord[], DataRecord[]) throws an exception.
        Specified by:
        transformOnError in interface RecordTransform
        Parameters:
        exception - an exception that caused RecordTransform.transform(DataRecord[], DataRecord[]) to fail
        sources - Source DataRecords
        target - Target DataRecord
        Returns:
        RecordTransform.ALL -- send the data record(s) to all the output ports
        RecordTransform.SKIP -- skip the data record(s)
        >= 0 -- send the data record(s) to a specified output port
        < -1 -- fatal error / user defined
        Throws:
        TransformException

      • defaultTransform

        protected boolean defaultTransform(DataRecord[] inputRecords,
                       DataRecord[] outputRecords)
        This default transformation only copies content of inputRecords into outputRecords field by field. See DataRecord.copyFieldsByPosition() method.
        Parameters:
        inputRecords - input data records (an array)
        outputRecords - output data records (an array)
        Returns:
        true if successful

        public void signal(java.lang.Object signalObject)
        Description copied from interface: RecordTransform
        Method which can be used for signalling into transformation that something outside happened.
        For example in aggregation component key changed.
        Specified by:
        signal in interface RecordTransform
        Parameters:
        signalObject - particular data object - depends on concrete implementation

        public final IConnection getConnection(java.lang.String id)
        Returns IConnection object registered with transformation graph under specified name (ID).

        Returns:
